item.title: Mopar activity
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

Wouldn’t that be idealistic.

Not “liking” private servers isn’t the issue. The issue is the amount of spam and general crap that is either posted or misposted, that has truly nothing to do with what I thought the foundations of this site were about.

So what, just don't go in their forums
Somehow, the hundreds of 1-5 posters screwing up all of the other forums make this seem rather pointless.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar activity
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

Although the idea of “community” is romantic, it’s not really sustainable if your main attraction is targeted at mostly immature people.
I really do not care if I am stereotyping like this, I am right. Your private server forums generally attract hundreds of 1-5 posters, and this is very clearly evident by the amount of crap that is posted non-stop. It is not a “select” few doing this.

As for your hand in hand comment, which I needed help decyphering, I entirely disagree.
Cheating on live, a fight against jagex and their updates, finding clever ways to go around the things that people try to stop you doing.
Server development, the creation of content, a “fun” thing to do.
They are really not related, and as you can very evidently see, the combination of both on a single site is not getting a positive outcome.

I will restate myself, as you seemed to have ignored me. I am not against the idea of a private server community, I just feel & know that both will be better off if you move private server forums to to their own at http://moparisthebest.com, and keep the live cheating forums here at http://moparisthebest.com. You can always cross-link between each other.

I must add, that this situation could be controlled through some hard work by admins and moderators, but as this is not happening on a grand enough scale, seperation is the next best thing to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar activity
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:14, topic:9111”]the 2 go hand in hand though server development is depended on client study and to seperate you would loose the information, and neither one is greater than the other that type of thinking is just sterotypical and it really pisses me off in the end, to put blame or put down a community just because a select few of them choose not to read shouldnt happen. its not the subject that caused the forums to goto shit, its people when it comes down to it, people like you that have to put blame on someone, other people that just dont give a fuck, and the people that dont read / communicate is what makes a forum goto shit because they call it a community for a reason

community - 1 : a unified body of individuals: as a : STATE, COMMONWEALTH[/quote]

Learn grammar, then come back.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar activity
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

to talk like that are u singling out scar scripters and everyone not in client hacking as well
When I said "traditional methods of cheating" it was entirely my intention to include SCAR'ers, Client Hackers, or otherwise that is used to cheat on the live version of the game.

Believe me, I respect people who SCAR, it is simply another means to achieve a similar objective.

I am not arguing the fact that making private servers is “fun” or a “hobby”. I am arguing that this particular “hobby” has turned this particular forum to shit, and I am begging mopar to move it to another site, seperating the two “hobbies”, and the two levels of maturity that seem to be associated with each.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar activity
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“NOURLOL, post:10, topic:9111”][quote]cant really put blame on the private servers for the noobs[/quote]I can and I will. The words “private” & “server” are a fucking whoop-de-doo massive novelty to 10 year olds who wouldn’t be attracted to the traditional methods of cheating.

[quote]you get the same mindless noob in client dev as you do in server dev only thing is server dev is much more popular, need an example? ARYAN.[/quote]People flock where the most excitement is. Go look at the client hacking forums, I dare you. The most active threads are by complete fuckhead morons who are posting either stupid questions or in the wrong section.

This site is providing a goddamned means to access and discuss the novelty of private servers, which needs to be seperated from traditional cheating, and I sure hope mopar makes up what part of his site he would rather preserve, not that there is much to preserve in terms of private server hacking.

if anything server developement helps bring fresh people in the cheating community[/quote]I, honest to god, have not seen a single “good” coder by any decent standards emerge from the RS2 server development on this site.

to talk like that are u singling out scar scripters and everyone not in client hacking as well? just because you would choose to not cheat in the real game and rather make your own dosnt make the person any less of a noob than the kid trying his first scar script, fact of the matter is its all hobbies for enjoyment and this constant discrimination on private servers really should be stopped

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar activity
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

cant really put blame on the private servers for the noobs
I can and I will. The words "private" & "server" are a fucking whoop-de-doo massive novelty to 10 year olds who wouldn't be attracted to the traditional methods of cheating.
you get the same mindless noob in client dev as you do in server dev only thing is server dev is much more popular, need an example? ARYAN.
People flock where the most excitement is. Go look at the client hacking forums, I dare you. The most active threads are by complete fuckhead morons who are posting either stupid questions or in the wrong section.

This site is providing a goddamned means to access and discuss the novelty of private servers, which needs to be seperated from traditional cheating, and I sure hope mopar makes up what part of his site he would rather preserve, not that there is much to preserve in terms of private server hacking.

if anything server developement helps bring fresh people in the cheating community
I, honest to god, have not seen a single "good" coder, or otherwise, by any decent standards emerge from the RS2 server development on this site.

Read full topic

cant really put blame on the private servers for the noobs, and it really hasnt turned the forum into shit you get the same mindless noob in client dev as you do in server dev only thing is server dev is much more popular, need an example? ARYAN. if anything server developement helps bring fresh people in the cheating community, im not talking all of them but a select few have moved on from server deving to client deving.
